title: "Invalid Asset" Sticker: Discord Error Explained + Ways to Fix It

steps.title: The "Invalid Asset" error means your sticker wasn't saved properly.
steps.content: The "Invalid Asset" error means your sticker wasn't saved properly. Discord will only accept PNG, APNG, and GIF images for stickers. If you saved your sticker as a different file type and just changed the ending to .PNG, .APNG, or .GIF, Discord will give the "Invalid Asset" error.

steps.title: Save your sticker as a PNG or GIF from an image editor.
steps.content: Save your sticker as a PNG or GIF from an image editor. If you're saving a still image, just about every image editor and art program has the ability to save a PNG file. Most image editors can save GIF files as well, but you'll need a program that has a timeline feature (like Photoshop) or video editing software to save an animated GIF. You can also use an online photo editor like Photopea to save your image as a PNG or GIF.

steps.title: Convert your image to PNG, GIF, or APNG.
steps.content: Convert your image to PNG, GIF, or APNG. If your sticker is saved in an unaccepted file type and you're not able to save it as a PNG, GIF, or APNG, you can convert it using an online converter. CloudConvert has PNG and GIF converters. EZGif can convert GIFs to APNGs.

steps.title: Send a WEBP image in Discord, then open it up and save it as a PNG.
steps.content: Send a WEBP image in Discord, then open it up and save it as a PNG. If you're trying to add a sticker that's a WEBP file, try this quick and easy workaround. Copy the WEBP image and send it in a Discord message. Click on the image, then click Open in Browser in the bottom-left corner. You can now save the image, which has been converted to a PNG, and upload it as a sticker . Discord doesn't appear to support WEBP images, so when you send one in a Discord message, Discord will automatically convert it to PNG.

steps.title: Recommended image dimensions
steps.content: Recommended image dimensions 320px x 320px [1] X Research source
